DataElement.preferredName: Pancreatic Carcinoma Pathology Treatment Recommendation Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The recommended treatment of pancreatic carcinoma pathology based on classification of disease.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A carcinoma arising from the exocrine pancreas. The overwhelming majority of pancreatic carcinomas are adenocarcinomas._The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Informally used to mean the result of such an examination._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process._Advice telling someone what the best thing to do is.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A carcinoma arising from the exocrine pancreas. The overwhelming majority of pancreatic carcinomas are adenocarcinomas.:The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Informally used to mean the result of such an examination.

Concepts.definition: A carcinoma arising from the exocrine pancreas. The overwhelming majority of pancreatic carcinomas are adenocarcinomas.

The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Informally used to mean the result of such an examination.

Property.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Advice telling someone what the best thing to do is.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.
Advice telling someone what the best thing to do is.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

PermissibleValues.value: Worrisome features: Evaluation by endoscopic ultrasonography (EUS)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An ultrasound administered by using a tube containing flexible fibre optic wires that allows for the analysis of tissues inside the body.  Ultrasound technology utilizes high frequency waves and their echoes to produce an image. 2005

Concepts.definition: An ultrasound administered by using a tube containing flexible fibre optic wires that allows for the analysis of tissues inside the body.  Ultrasound technology utilizes high frequency waves and their echoes to produce an image. 2005

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.
